articles.title: Sundar Pichai is ‘very excited’ about Google Cloud’s OpenAI partnership
articles.description: The comment came shortly after analysts peppered Pichai and other Google executives with questions about how AI would affect its core search business and why Google is spending an extra $10 billion on capital expenditures this year to catch up in the AI race.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.content: The comment came shortly after analysts peppered Pichai and other Google executives with questions about how AI would affect its core search business and why Google is spending an extra $10 billion on capital expenditures this year to catch up in the AI race.

articles.title: Kyruus builds a generative AI provider matching solution on AWS
articles.description: In this post, we demonstrate how Kyruus Health uses AWS services to build Guide. We show how Amazon Bedrock, a fully managed service that provides access to foundation models (FMs) from leading AI companies and Amazon through a single API, and Amazon OpenSearch Service, a managed search and analytics service, work together to understand everyday language about health concerns and connect members with the right providers.
articles.author: Zach Heath
articles.content: In this post, we demonstrate how Kyruus Health uses AWS services to build Guide. We show how Amazon Bedrock, a fully managed service that provides access to foundation models (FMs) from leading AI companies and Amazon through a single API, and Amazon OpenSearch Service, a managed search and analytics service, work together to understand everyday language about health concerns and connect members with the right providers.

articles.title: Unlocking 20% Growth: How India’s Data Centre Surge is Reshaping Tech Services
articles.description: Fueled by cloud, AI, and 5G, this surge promises a 20% revenue growth in the tech services sector, job creation, and a new era of digital infrastructure. The post Unlocking 20% Growth: How India’s Data Centre Surge is Reshaping Tech Services appeared first on Analytics India Magazine.

articles.content: Fueled by cloud, AI, and 5G, this surge promises a 20% revenue growth in the tech services sector, job creation, and a new era of digital infrastructure. articles.title: Building enterprise-scale RAG applications with Amazon S3 Vectors and DeepSeek R1 on Amazon SageMaker AI
articles.description: Organizations are adopting large language models (LLMs), such as DeepSeek R1, to transform business processes, enhance customer experiences, and drive innovation at unprecedented speed. However, standalone LLMs have key limitations such as hallucinations, outdated knowledge, and no access to proprietary data. Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) addresses these gaps by combining semantic search with generative AI, […]
articles.author: Sandeep Raveesh-Babu

Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) addresses these gaps by combining semantic search with generative AI, […]

articles.title: Elastic Stack 8.18.4 released
articles.description: Version 8.18.4 of the Elastic Stack was released today. We recommend you upgrade to this latest version. We recommend 8.18.4 over the previous versions 8.18.3 The 8.18.4 Release contains various performance and stability improvements across the stack. Logstash's persistent queue now has significantly higher throughput when its workers are caught up. We eliminated lock contention in pipeline workers to ensure that queue writers have priority when there aren't yet enough events in the queue to...
articles.author: Ksenia Vasileva
articles.content: Version 8.18.4 of the Elastic Stack was released today. We recommend you upgrade to this latest version. We recommend 8.18.4 over the previous versions 8.18.3 The 8.18.4 Release contains various performance and stability improvements across the stack. Logstash's persistent queue now has significantly higher throughput when its workers are caught up. We eliminated lock contention in pipeline workers to ensure that queue writers have priority when there aren't yet enough events in the queue to...

articles.title: A Quantum Leap Forward
articles.description: Scientists may have turned the corner on the quantum error correction challenge.
articles.author: Samuel Greengard
articles.content: Scientists may have turned the corner on the quantum error correction challenge.

articles.title: Build real-time travel recommendations using AI agents on Amazon Bedrock
articles.description: In this post, we show how to build a generative AI solution using Amazon Bedrock that creates bespoke holiday packages by combining customer profiles and preferences with real-time pricing data. We demonstrate how to use Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases for travel information, Amazon Bedrock Agents for real-time flight details, and Amazon OpenSearch Serverless for efficient package search and retrieval.
articles.author: Vishnu Vardhini
articles.content: In this post, we show how to build a generative AI solution using Amazon Bedrock that creates bespoke holiday packages by combining customer profiles and preferences with real-time pricing data. We demonstrate how to use Amazon Bedrock Knowledge Bases for travel information, Amazon Bedrock Agents for real-time flight details, and Amazon OpenSearch Serverless for efficient package search and retrieval.

articles.title: Beyond accelerators: Lessons from building foundation models on AWS with Japan’s GENIAC program
articles.description: In 2024, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) launched the Generative AI Accelerator Challenge (GENIAC)—a Japanese national program to boost generative AI by providing companies with funding, mentorship, and massive compute resources for foundation model (FM) development. AWS was selected as the cloud provider for GENIAC’s second cycle (cycle 2). It provided infrastructure and technical guidance for 12 participating organizations.
articles.author: Keita Watanabe
articles.content: In 2024, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) launched the Generative AI Accelerator Challenge (GENIAC)—a Japanese national program to boost generative AI by providing companies with funding, mentorship, and massive compute resources for foundation model (FM) development. AWS was selected as the cloud provider for GENIAC’s second cycle (cycle 2). It provided infrastructure and technical guidance for 12 participating organizations.

articles.title: Court Battles Spark an Unexpected AI Movement: Fairness by Design
articles.description: Engineers, data scientists, and algorithmic auditors are developing sophisticated tools and methodologies to prevent bias. Traditional approaches to AI bias have been largely reactive. The stakes couldn't be higher: as AI systems make increasingly consequential decisions, the technical infrastructure for ensuring fairness may determine whether these technologies become instruments of justice.Read All
articles.content: Engineers, data scientists, and algorithmic auditors are developing sophisticated tools and methodologies to prevent bias. Traditional approaches to AI bias have been largely reactive. The stakes couldn't be higher: as AI systems make increasingly consequential decisions, the technical infrastructure for ensuring fairness may determine whether these technologies become instruments of justice.Read All

articles.title: A behaviour monitoring dataset of wild mammals in the Swiss Alps
articles.description: Two roe deer foraging, with manual annotations for each individual animal. Credit: A. Mathis (EPFL). By Nik Papageorgiou Have you ever wondered how wild animals behave when no one’s watching? Understanding these behaviors is vital for protecting ecosystems—especially as climate change and human expansion alter natural habitats. But collecting this kind of information without interfering […]

articles.title: Technical Perspective: Defending Data from SRAM-Based Attacks
articles.description: SRAM-based attacks include recovering portions of memory from internal caches, internal RAM, and some CPU registers; attaching voltage probes that can keep SRAM powered on SoCs.
articles.author: Stefan Saroiu
articles.content: SRAM-based attacks include recovering portions of memory from internal caches, internal RAM, and some CPU registers; attaching voltage probes that can keep SRAM powered on SoCs.

articles.title: Isambard-AI, the UK’s Most Powerful AI Supercomputer, Goes Live
articles.description: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.
articles.author: Brian Caulfield
articles.content: The University of Bristol’s Isambard-AI, powered by NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips, delivers 21 exaflops of AI performance, making it the fastest system in the U.K. and among the most energy-efficient globally.

articles.title: Exploring the Frontiers of kNN Noisy Feature Detection and Recovery for Self-Driving Labs
articles.description: arXiv:2507.16833v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Self-driving laboratories (SDLs) have shown promise to accelerate materials discovery by integrating machine learning with automated experimental platforms. However, errors in the capture of input parameters may corrupt the features used to model system performance, compromising current and future campaigns. This study develops an automated workflow to systematically detect noisy features, determine sample-feature pairings that can be corrected,...
articles.author: Qiuyu Shi, Kangming Li, Yao Fehlis, Daniel Persaud, Robert Black, Jason Hattrick-Simpers
articles.content: arXiv:2507.16833v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Self-driving laboratories (SDLs) have shown promise to accelerate materials discovery by integrating machine learning with automated experimental platforms. However, errors in the capture of input parameters may corrupt the features used to model system performance, compromising current and future campaigns. This study develops an automated workflow to systematically detect noisy features, determine sample-feature pairings that can be corrected,...

articles.title: laplax -- Laplace Approximations with JAX
articles.description: arXiv:2507.17013v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Laplace approximation provides a scalable and efficient means of quantifying weight-space uncertainty in deep neural networks, enabling the application of Bayesian tools such as predictive uncertainty and model selection via Occam's razor. In this work, we introduce laplax, a new open-source Python package for performing Laplace approximations with jax. Designed with a modular and purely functional architecture and minimal external...
articles.author: Tobias Weber, B\'alint Mucs\'anyi, Lenard Rommel, Thomas Christie, Lars Kas\"uschke, Marvin Pf\"ortner, Philipp Hennig

articles.title: Advancing Robustness in Deep Reinforcement Learning with an Ensemble Defense Approach
articles.description: arXiv:2507.17070v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advancements in Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) have demonstrated its applicability across various domains, including robotics, healthcare, energy optimization, and autonomous driving. However, a critical question remains: How robust are DRL models when exposed to adversarial attacks? While existing defense mechanisms such as adversarial training and distillation enhance the resilience of DRL models, there remains a significant research...
articles.author: Adithya Mohan, Dominik R\"o{\ss}le, Daniel Cremers, Torsten Sch\"on

However, a critical question remains: How robust are DRL models when exposed to adversarial attacks? While existing defense mechanisms such as adversarial training and distillation enhance the resilience of DRL models, there remains a significant research...

articles.title: SiLQ: Simple Large Language Model Quantization-Aware Training
articles.description: arXiv:2507.16933v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models can be quantized to reduce inference time latency, model size, and energy consumption, thereby delivering a better user experience at lower cost. A challenge exists to deliver quantized models with minimal loss of accuracy in reasonable time, and in particular to do so without requiring mechanisms incompatible with specialized inference accelerators. Here, we demonstrate a simple, end-to-end quantization-aware training...
articles.author: Steven K. Esser, Jeffrey L. McKinstry, Deepika Bablani, Rathinakumar Appuswamy, Dharmendra S. Modha
articles.content: arXiv:2507.16933v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models can be quantized to reduce inference time latency, model size, and energy consumption, thereby delivering a better user experience at lower cost. A challenge exists to deliver quantized models with minimal loss of accuracy in reasonable time, and in particular to do so without requiring mechanisms incompatible with specialized inference accelerators. Here, we demonstrate a simple, end-to-end quantization-aware training...

articles.title: Post-Disaster Affected Area Segmentation with a Vision Transformer (ViT)-based EVAP Model using Sentinel-2 and Formosat-5 Imagery
articles.description: arXiv:2507.16849v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose a vision transformer (ViT)-based deep learning framework to refine disaster-affected area segmentation from remote sensing imagery, aiming to support and enhance the Emergent Value Added Product (EVAP) developed by the Taiwan Space Agency (TASA). The process starts with a small set of manually annotated regions. We then apply principal component analysis (PCA)-based feature space analysis and construct a confidence index (CI) to expand...
articles.author: Yi-Shan Chu, Hsuan-Cheng Wei
articles.content: arXiv:2507.16849v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose a vision transformer (ViT)-based deep learning framework to refine disaster-affected area segmentation from remote sensing imagery, aiming to support and enhance the Emergent Value Added Product (EVAP) developed by the Taiwan Space Agency (TASA). The process starts with a small set of manually annotated regions. We then apply principal component analysis (PCA)-based feature space analysis and construct a confidence index (CI) to expand...

articles.title: SIA: Enhancing Safety via Intent Awareness for Vision-Language Models
articles.description: arXiv:2507.16856v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As vision-language models (VLMs) are increasingly deployed in real-world applications, new safety risks arise from the subtle interplay between images and text. In particular, seemingly innocuous inputs can combine to reveal harmful intent, leading to unsafe model responses. Despite increasing attention to multimodal safety, previous approaches based on post hoc filtering or static refusal prompts struggle to detect such latent risks, especially...
articles.author: Youngjin Na, Sangheon Jeong, Youngwan Lee
articles.content: arXiv:2507.16856v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As vision-language models (VLMs) are increasingly deployed in real-world applications, new safety risks arise from the subtle interplay between images and text. In particular, seemingly innocuous inputs can combine to reveal harmful intent, leading to unsafe model responses. Despite increasing attention to multimodal safety, previous approaches based on post hoc filtering or static refusal prompts struggle to detect such latent risks, especially...

articles.title: Reinforcement Learning in hyperbolic space for multi-step reasoning
articles.description: arXiv:2507.16864v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-step reasoning is a fundamental challenge in artificial intelligence, with applications ranging from mathematical problem-solving to decision-making in dynamic environments. Reinforcement Learning (RL) has shown promise in enabling agents to perform multi-step reasoning by optimizing long-term rewards. However, conventional RL methods struggle with complex reasoning tasks due to issues such as credit assignment, high-dimensional state...
articles.author: Tao Xu, Dung-Yang Lee, Momiao Xiong
articles.content: arXiv:2507.16864v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-step reasoning is a fundamental challenge in artificial intelligence, with applications ranging from mathematical problem-solving to decision-making in dynamic environments. Reinforcement Learning (RL) has shown promise in enabling agents to perform multi-step reasoning by optimizing long-term rewards. However, conventional RL methods struggle with complex reasoning tasks due to issues such as credit assignment, high-dimensional state...

articles.title: Bayesian preference elicitation for decision support in multiobjective optimization
articles.description: arXiv:2507.16999v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a novel approach to help decision-makers efficiently identify preferred solutions from the Pareto set of a multi-objective optimization problem. Our method uses a Bayesian model to estimate the decision-maker's utility function based on pairwise comparisons. Aided by this model, a principled elicitation strategy selects queries interactively to balance exploration and exploitation, guiding the discovery of high-utility solutions. The...
articles.author: Felix Huber, Sebastian Rojas Gonzalez, Raul Astudillo
articles.content: arXiv:2507.16999v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a novel approach to help decision-makers efficiently identify preferred solutions from the Pareto set of a multi-objective optimization problem. Our method uses a Bayesian model to estimate the decision-maker's utility function based on pairwise comparisons. Aided by this model, a principled elicitation strategy selects queries interactively to balance exploration and exploitation, guiding the discovery of high-utility solutions. The...

articles.title: To Trust or Not to Trust: On Calibration in ML-based Resource Allocation for Wireless Networks
articles.description: arXiv:2507.17494v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In next-generation communications and networks, machine learning (ML) models are expected to deliver not only accurate predictions but also well-calibrated confidence scores that reflect the true likelihood of correct decisions. This paper studies the calibration performance of an ML-based outage predictor within a single-user, multi-resource allocation framework. We first establish key theoretical properties of this system's outage probability...
articles.author: Rashika Raina, Nidhi Simmons, David E. Simmons, Michel Daoud Yacoub, Trung Q. Duong
articles.content: arXiv:2507.17494v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In next-generation communications and networks, machine learning (ML) models are expected to deliver not only accurate predictions but also well-calibrated confidence scores that reflect the true likelihood of correct decisions. This paper studies the calibration performance of an ML-based outage predictor within a single-user, multi-resource allocation framework. articles.title: Avoiding spectral pollution for transfer operators using residuals
articles.description: arXiv:2507.16915v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Koopman operator theory enables linear analysis of nonlinear dynamical systems by lifting their evolution to infinite-dimensional function spaces. However, finite-dimensional approximations of Koopman and transfer (Frobenius--Perron) operators are prone to spectral pollution, introducing spurious eigenvalues that can compromise spectral computations. While recent advances have yielded provably convergent methods for Koopman operators, analogous...
articles.author: April Herwig, Matthew J. Colbrook, Oliver Junge, P\'eter Koltai, Julia Slipantschuk
